proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: F on BO, CO, G on BC, ∠OCB, 3.14 = pi, ∠AOC, ∠EOA, ∠BOC, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF, pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), B on ⊙(O, radius_O), ∠CBO, ∠GBO, Arc(AOC), C on ⊙(O, radius_O), BO, ∠COE, Arc(EOA), BC

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on BC, ∠OCB
Conclusions: ∠OCB = ∠OCG

Step 3:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = 2 * pi

Step 4:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : B on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = BO

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on BC, ∠CBO
Conclusions: ∠CBO = ∠GBO

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠GBO, F on BO
Conclusions: ∠GBF = ∠GBO

Step 7:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)

Step 8:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : C on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = CO

Step 9:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠AOC, ∠EOA, ∠COE
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA

Step 10:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠COE, ∠BOC
Conclusions: pi = ∠BOC + ∠COE

Step 11:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(EOA)
Conclusions: ∠EOA = Arc(EOA)

Step 12:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : BO, CO, BC
Conclusions: △BCO

Step 13:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GBF = ∠GBO, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_O = BO, radius_O = CO
Conclusions: BO = CO

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA, 6.28 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠BOC + ∠COE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠BOC + ∠COE

Step 18:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(O, C, B)
Premises : △BCO
Conclusions: pi = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBO = ∠GBO, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO

Step 20:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : △BCO, BO = CO
Conclusions: ∠CBO = ∠OCB

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB

Step 22:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠CBO

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠OCB = ∠OCG, ∠CBO = ∠OCB, 0.44 = ∠CBO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠OCG

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠OCB = ∠OCG, 0.44 = ∠OCG
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠OCB

Step 25:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 6.28 = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC, 3.14 = ∠BOC + ∠COE, 3.14 = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB, 0.44 = ∠OCB, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO, pi = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB
Conclusions: 4.01 = ∠EOA

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EOA = Arc(EOA), 4.01 = ∠EOA
Conclusions: 4.01 = Arc(EOA)
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Arc(A, O, C)), MeasureOf(Arc(D, O, B)))
